title: Drawing, "Design for a Lip Spout Pitcher", 1701–50
medium: Graphite, pen and bistre on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The handle is at right. At left below the spout at the shoulder is a swan, supporting a winged putto. A ribbon passes along the neck, under the wing, then above a cherub head, then to the handle.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Lip Spout Pitcher", 1701–50.
1701–50. Graphite, pen and bistre on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7412.
